metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2136 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The sock_alloc_send_pskb function in net/core/sock.c in the Linux kernel before 3.4.5 does not properly validate a certain length value, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and system crash) or possibly gain privileges by leveraging access to a TUN/TAP device. An error was discovered in the Linux kernel's network TUN/TAP device implementation. A local user with access to the TUN/TAP interface (which is not available to unprivileged users until granted by a root user) could exploit this flaw to crash the system or potential gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2136` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19

linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> linux-armadaxp is maintained by OEM tyhicks> No upstream fix yet, but an initial patch is under review (see References) Patch tags indicate that 2.6.27+ is affected.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
